results.content:
Great upto here. But I am afraid of deployment in Ubuntu server. Is it compulsory to deploy in Ubuntu server? Or we can deploy it in our localhost?

Kind regards

response.content:
I am glad you liked it. No, it is not compulsory. There are lots of techniques to deploy your app on the server (digital ocean, AWS, Heroku, centos server, using docker, etc). But most of the time I used to deploy it on the Ubuntu server, I feel easy to deploy there. 
If you are using localhost, that means the web-app is only available for you within the same computer. If you want to provide a service which can be accessible to others, you need to deploy it into the server by any techniques.
response.content_html:
I am glad you liked it. No, it is not compulsory. There are lots of techniques to deploy your app on the server (digital ocean, AWS, Heroku, centos server, using docker, etc). But most of the time I used to deploy it on the Ubuntu server, I feel easy to deploy there.
If you are using localhost, that means the web-app is only available for you within the same computer. If you want to provide a service which can be accessible to others, you need to deploy it into the server by any techniques.

results.content_html:
Great upto here. But I am afraid of deployment in Ubuntu server. Is it compulsory to deploy in Ubuntu server? Or we can deploy it in our localhost?

Kind regards

results.content:
I didn't know much about GeoDjango and this course just introduced me to something I was looking to learn for web-gis projects, especially the backend and administration sides. The GeoServer rest was also great for me.
Just which for the trainer to go further by showing to modify data and persist it on-the-fly and maybe a great course on GeoServer services. Congrats.
